        public FluentShortMessageMessageAssert(List<ShortMessageWithContext<S>> actual,
                                       P parent,
                                       AssertionRegistry registry)
        Initializes with the list of short messages and the parent.
        Parameters:
        actual - the list of short messages (whit extra context for error reporting)
        parent - the parent (used by HasParent.and())
        registry - used to register assertions

    • Method Detail

      • header

        public FluentShortMessageMessageAssert<P,S> header(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super Byte[]> matcher)
        Make assertions on the header byte array of short message field of the message(s) using fluent API. The header byte array may be null. This is the default behavior. However, if the original message is split into several segments, each segment has a header that contains information to indicate how the message was split (number of segments, reference number, current segment number, ...). 
         .receivedMessages()
   .message(0)
     .rawRequest()
       .shortMessage()
         .header(array(equalTo(0x01), equalTo(0x02)))
        Will check if the header byte array of the first message is exactly [0x01, 0x02]. 
         .receivedMessages()
   .every()
     .rawRequest()
       .shortMessage()
         .header(array(equalTo(0x01), equalTo(0x02)))
        Will check if the header byte array of every message is exactly [0x01, 0x02].
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the header
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • payload

        public FluentShortMessageMessageAssert<P,S> payload(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super Byte[]> matcher)
        Make assertions on the payload byte array of short message field of the message(s) using fluent API. The payload is the part without the header (see header(Matcher)). It contains the message (as byte array) displayed to the end-user. 
         .receivedMessages()
   .message(0)
     .rawRequest()
       .shortMessage()
         .payload(arrayWithSize(160))
        Will check if the payload byte array of the first message has exactly 160 bytes. 
         .receivedMessages()
   .every()
     .rawRequest()
       .shortMessage()
         .payload(arrayWithSize(160))
        Will check if the payload byte array of the first message has exactly 160 bytes.
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the payload
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)
